body_content.explanation: a tall evergreen tree (= one that never loses its leaves) that grows on the east coast of the United States:
examples: Atlantic white cedars continue to grow until they are about 50 years old.
They stood under an old white cedar tree that cast shadows all round.
They are attempting to restore Atantic white cedar in the park after so many were destroyed by the hurricane.

body_content.explanation: the wood of the Atlantic white cedar, used for building houses, boats, and fences:
examples: They used planks of Atlantic white cedar to clad the walls.
The canoe was beautifully hand-built from American white cedar.
